Data: The news from the Wanderers is that South Africa have won the toss and opted to field.
Steyn to Warner, no run shapes himself for a big one with that high backlift but the ball isn't there to hit, bowled on a good length on middle, pushed to mid-on
Steyn to Warner, no run spat off the pitch, a scorcher that, slightly back of a length on the off stump and shot off to evade the outside edge as he tried to defend that off the back foot

Steyn to Warner, 1 run superb stuff, stopped a bit on Warner, caught him by surprise as it zipped off the wicket, caught the outside edge and flew towards third man, he tried to play that down with soft hands but was a little late on the shot, no damage done though
Steyn to Clarke, no run similar delivery but to the right hander this time, Clarke dealt with it well, unlike Warner he backed away from it
Steyn to Clarke, no run missed opportunity, short and wide, there to cut, he tries to do exactly that but the ball moves away at the right moment to have him reaching for that one
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run short of a good length outside off, dabbed wide of Duminy at cover for a quick single
Parnell to Clarke, 1 wide starts off with a wide but bowled at a decent pace there, had Clarke reaching for a cut, missed it obviously, hence the wide
Parnell to Clarke, 1 run much closer to the off stump and bowled a touch fuller, closes the face to push that short of mid-on for a quick single
Parnell to Warner, no run good pace, short of a good length on middle and leg at 143 kmph, defended off the back foot towards midwicket
Parnell to Warner, 1 run slower through the air and erred in length there, full on the pads, clipped away elegantly to fine leg

Parnell to Clarke, no run well stopped, full on the off stump, Clarke plays a delightful drive back to the bowler, Parnell bends low, it catches him on the foot, and prevents a couple of runs, did well to get his body behind that one

Parnell to Clarke, OUT timber! Parnell gets one, fullish on the off stump, held its line, Clarke had decided he would go after that one, bowled at 143 kmph, he makes room to smash that over extra cover, misses and the stumps take a beating!
Parnell to Ponting, no run
Steyn to Warner, FOUR runs full on the off stump, stands his ground and dispatches it over mid-on for a one bounce four, got under it nicely there, meaty length ball that got the treatment
Steyn to Warner, 2 runs short of a good length on middle, mistimes a pull wide of fine leg for a couple, would have wanted to get that much squarer
Steyn to Warner, 1 wide slower ball, misdirected though, well outside off stump and it's given a wide
Steyn to Warner, 1 run back of a length on the off stump, dragged wide of mid-on for a single
Steyn to Ponting, 1 leg bye shuffles to work it away behind square, is struck on the pads, would have been going down anyway, gets a leg bye
Steyn to Warner, 1 run slower ball bowled short on leg stump, turned away towards square leg for a single
Steyn to Ponting, 1 run short of a good length outside off, punched firmly wide of cover where Duminy dives full length to his right to stop that and prevent a couple of runs
Morkel to Ponting, no run good length on middle and off, defended off the front foot towards cover

Morkel to Ponting, OUT poor shot really, hit a good length on middle and leg, Ponting stayed in his crease and tried to clear mid-on, wasn't to the pitch at all, ended up mistiming it towards Johan Botha who ran a few steps back and pouched it gleefully.
Morkel to Warner, no run held it back a little, pitched it a little short outside off, punched off the back foot to cover, well timed but straight to the fielder
Morkel to Warner, 1 run low full toss on the off stump, steps wide and tries to force it through the off-side field, finds the cover fielder but scrambles a single
Morkel to Hussey, no run shaping away from the right hander, full outside off, almost yorker length, dug out between point and cover, the bowling change has paid off, at least until now
Morkel to Hussey, no run good over, bowled on the off stump, giving him no room, plays that with an angled bat towards point
Parnell to Warner, 1 run on middle and off, dropped into the off side short of mid-off for a single
Parnell to Hussey, FOUR runs shot! Short and wide, makes room, bends a little and cuts it away behind point, third man had no chance there

Parnell to Hussey, no run run out appeal, dropped into the off side towards cover and Warner rushes in for a single, he's halfway down the pitch at the non-striker's end, the fielder returns the throw to Parnell who flicks it onto the stumps, Warner has dived full stretch but his bat appears to be in the air as he tries to slide it back into
Parnell to Hussey, no run full on leg stump, tries to flick it away fine, misses, would have gone down
Parnell to Hussey, 1 run bowled on a good length at 124.1 kmph on the off stump, tries to drive it wide of mid-off, gets a thick inside edge towards mid -on
Parnell to Warner, 1 run full length on the off stump, driven crisply wide of Amla at mid-off where he dives to his right and keeps them down to a single
Morkel to Warner, FOUR runs back of a length on the off stump, gets the treatment, pulled away powerfully behind square, sped off the bat
Morkel to Warner, 1 leg bye tried to turn it away fine, hit high on the pads and ball drops just wide of the stumps, they sneak a quick single
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run yorker length on the off stump, dug out wide of mid-off for a single
Morkel to Warner, FOUR runs struck well, attempted yorker again but Warner gets forward, converts it into a full toss and drills that down the ground wide of mid-on
Morkel to Warner, SIX runs change of pace but Warner picked the slower one, landed full on middle, he took a step forward, got under it nicely and lofted it cleanly over the long-on boundary
Morkel to Warner, no run better, bowled on a good length on middle, worked up good pace, defended to mid-on off the back foot
Botha to Hussey, no run full on middle and leg, tossed up, driven straight to midwicket
Botha to Hussey, 1 run on middle and off, gets outside the line and turns it away wide of short fine for a single
Botha to Warner, 2 runs back of a length outside off, cut away behind point for a couple, came back well for the second there

Botha to Warner, FOUR runs quicker through the air, landed on a good length on middle and spun away sharply, Warner came forward to defend, was beaten by the spin, caught the outside edge and the ball rolls over the third-man boundary
Botha to Warner, no run round the wicket now, on middle and off, turned away to midwicket
Botha to Warner, no run quicker and full on the off stump, slaps it back to the bowler, mistimed it there
Peterson to Hussey, 2 runs misfield at extra cover, driven straight to him but AB de Villiers gets a bad bounce, they get a couple between long-off and deep cover
Peterson to Hussey, 2 runs flighted on middle, driven down the ground towards long-on where some lax fielding allows them to come back for the second
Peterson to Hussey, SIX runs welcome runs, full outside off, Hussey makes room and smashes that over the extra-cover boundary, fiercely struck, a flat six that
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run wristy, full on middle, drives that subcontinental-style towards long-on
Peterson to Warner, no run attemps a slog-sweep, mistimes it straight to midwicket, there to hit, a length ball that but couldn't connect it well
Peterson to Warner, 1 run full on leg stump but fired in quick, he can just dig it out and salvage a single towards long-on
Botha to Warner, no run well bowled, bowling fairly quick here, full on leg stump, drives it inside out to cover
Botha to Warner, 1 run full on middle and leg, driven to Amla at long-on
Botha to Hussey, 1 run well struck but there's cover, flat on the off stump, drilled down the ground but Amla's there at long-off
Botha to Warner, 2 runs goes for it, full on leg stump, tries to heave it over midwicket, mistimes it but still manages a couple, Duminy runs well to his left, slides and prevents any further damage
Botha to Warner, 1 run good length on the off stump, driven to long-off
Botha to Hussey, SIX runs that's disappeared, timely hit, flighted on the off stump, much slower through the air, Hussey's eyes light up, he gets under it and dismisses it over the long-on boundary

Peterson to Warner, OUT excellent reflexes by Peterson! Bowled full on the off stump, Warner picks the length and swats it firmly but straight towards the bowler, Peterson reacts well, bends down and takes it low.

Peterson to Hussey, OUT run out, Australia are struggling now, turned away towards short fine where the fielder rockets in a powerful throw at the non-strikers end, Micheal Hussey has already set off for the single but isn't quick enough, dives full length but a direct hit catches him well short of his ground
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-off
Peterson to Haddin, no run full on middle and leg, driven back to the bowler
Peterson to Haddin, no run flighted on middle and off, struck firmly but back to Peterson

Peterson to Haddin, OUT he's thrown it away! Flighted on the off stump, lands on a good length, Haddin lofts it lazily, no intent whatsoever in that stroke, finds Albie Morkel at long-off positioned exactly for some poor batting like that
Botha to White, no run tossed up on the off stump, pushed off the front foot to cover
Botha to White, no run turned away off the back foot towards square leg
Botha to White, 1 run driven down the ground to long-on to get off the mark
Botha to Hussey, no run low full toss on the off stump, bunts it to cover, a bump ball that, creates some excitement in the crowd
Botha to Hussey, 1 run flighted on the off stump, comes down the track and pushes it to long-on
Botha to White, 1 run gets on the back foot and punches it through the covers for a single
Peterson to White, 1 run short of a length outside off, gets back and slaps it to long-off, spun away there but he handled it well
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run full on middle and off, drives it through the line to long-off
Peterson to White, no run back of a length on the off stump, tries to pull it away over midwicket, mistimes it back to the bowler
Peterson to White, no run fired in on the leg stump, turned away straight to short fine
Peterson to White, no run the frustration grows, short outside off, bunts it straight to cover, fails to beat the fielder there
Peterson to White, 2 runs almost but gets away with it, lofted straight towards long-off but it falls well short of the fielder, thay have time to get back for the second
Morkel to Hussey, 2 runs full on the off stump, makes room and drives it through the gap between long-off and deep cover, gets a couple for his efforts
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run maintains a fullish length, outside off again, square-driven towards deep cover
Morkel to White, 1 run held it back this time, back of a length outside off, run down to third man for a single
Morkel to Hussey, no run full on middle and off, driven back to the bowler, bump ball again and crowd wastes some more energy with all its oohs and aahs
Morkel to Hussey, FOUR runs superbly hit, not even to the pitch but just played through the line, good length outside off, he gave himself some room there and just chipped it over extra cover
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run much fuller, strikes it down the ground towards long-on
Botha to Hussey, 1 run flighted ball bowled full on the leg stump, driven to long-on
Botha to White, no run well fielded, struck back towards the bowler, Botha dives to his left and saves a single
Botha to White, no run short of a length on the off stump, much slower through the air, punched straight to cover
Botha to White, 1 run good stuff, saw the batsman make some room there and fired it full, dug out towards long-on
Botha to Hussey, 1 run full toss, fails to cash in, on middle, swats it away towards deep square leg
Botha to White, 1 run low full toss outside off, much quicker, driven to long-off, excellent over
Parnell to White, 1 run almost, short of a length outside off, cut away uppishly towards Gibbs at point who dives to his left to pluck that but it falls just short
Parnell to Hussey, 1 run on middle and leg, worked away wide of midwicket for a single
Parnell to White, 1 run goes for it but fails to connect well, drives it uppishly towards long-off

Parnell to Hussey, 2 runs short of a length outside off, makes room , is deceived by the slower one, slaps it back over the bowler's head but it's completely mistimed, lands safely between long-off and long-on
Parnell to Hussey, SIX runs gets hold of it this time, bowled round the wicket, full outside off, reaches for it and creams it over the extra-cover boundary, went about 10-15 rows into the crowd
Parnell to Hussey, 1 run back of a length on middle, turned away between square leg and midwicket for a single, keeps the strike
Peterson to Hussey, SIX runs slogged away and it's over the ropes, full and straight on the off stump, bowled quick, heaves it over the deep midwicket boundary, reaches his 50 in style
Peterson to Hussey, 1 run short of a good length on leg stump, comes down the track, gets an inside edge towards short fine
Peterson to White, no run short on the off stump, pushed off the back foot to over, was al most fone in by the flight there, failed to pick it
Peterson to White, no run quick on middle, yorker length, dug out back to the bowler

Peterson to White, SIX runs attempts something similar this time but it's full and meaty on middle, White gets hold of this, was waiting for it for a long time and finally connects it well enough to clear deep midwicket, a typical limited-overs slog that

Peterson to White, OUT identical stroke but not the result, struck it well but the ball was bowled much slower through the air, heaved it, but straight to deep midwicket where Duminy judges it to perfection
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run full on middle and leg, gets his feet out of the way and drives it to long-on
Morkel to Johnson, no run back of a length on the off stump and nipped back in, dropped into the leg side, no single there
Morkel to Johnson, 1 run back of a length on middle, plays a short-arm pull towards long-on
Morkel to Hussey, 1 wide straying down the leg side, given a wide, the first one in a long time
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run full on middle and leg, chipped over midwicket but all they can manage is a single
Morkel to Johnson, 1 run attempted yorker, ends up as a full toss on leg stump, flicked away to deep square leg

Morkel to Hussey, SIX runs wow, that was something! Full on middle, length ball, so he pays for bowling that wide, Hussey gets stuck into that one, lofts it high and AB de Villiers at long on takes it over his head but trips over the boundary ropes, took forever to come down but poor ball by Albie. An excellent catch there, took it with one
Steyn to Johnson, 2 runs good length on the off stump, chipped wide of long-on for a couple
Steyn to Johnson, 1 run full outside off, slashes hard, it's a slower one, gets a thick edge towards third man
Steyn to Hussey, FOUR runs Hussey's the man, full outside off, in the slot, makes room and caresses it wide of a diving extra cover
Steyn to Hussey, 2 runs good comeback, yorker on leg stump, saw him making room there but the batsman is equal to the task, digs it out wide of deep square leg for a couple
Steyn to Hussey, 2 runs slower ball bowled full on middle, slogged over midwicket, Duminy dives full length to his left and drags that back just inside the ropes, two taken
Steyn to Hussey, FOUR runs Hussey's got Australia back in this, full on middle, shuffles outside of and tickles that well wide of short fine for a boundary
Parnell to Johnson, FOUR runs lucky! Good length outside off, goes for a flowing drive through the off side, gets a thin edge just pas the leg stump to the fine-leg boundary
Parnell to Johnson, 1 wide short of a good length outside off, it's moving away as he tries to cut, misses, and is called a wide
Parnell to Johnson, 1 run good length on middle and leg, driven down the ground to long-on
Parnell to Hussey, 1 run length ball on the off stump, gets away with it, Hussey plays it along the ground to long-on
Parnell to Johnson, no run deceived him with the slower one there, good length outside off and Johnson is already through with his attempted slog over midwicket, misses
Parnell to Johnson, no run beaten again, full outside off, tries to cross-bat that over midwicket again, misses and the frustration is writ large on his face

Parnell to Johnson, OUT bowled 'im! Good stuff from Parnell, in the blockhole on middle, Johnson tries to dig it out on the leg side but is a little too late in bringing his bat down, misses and the stumps are rattled
Steyn to Hussey, 1 run short of a good length outside off, makes room and creams it to deep cover
Steyn to Hopes, FOUR runs good shot, full outside off, makes room and slices that away behind point for a boundary
Steyn to Hopes, 1 run slower ball bowled on a good length on middle and leg, dabs it on the leg side towards square leg for a single

Steyn to Hussey, FOUR runs shot of the day, length ball again but had to be dealt with, overpitched on middle, moved away and drilled it past a diving cover to bisect the gap between long-off and deep cover

Steyn to Hussey, SIX runs what a knock! Picked the slower one there, ended up landing full on the off stump, waited for it and smashed it away over the long-on boundary, goes miles into the crowd and Australia have posted a competitive score here
Steyn to Hussey, 1 run struck fiercely but straight to the deep-cover fielder, raced off the bat but no damage done
We are in for some entertainment tonight, so join us in about ten minutes for the run-chase.

Australia have recovered superbly, thanks to David Hussey's stellar 88 off 44 balls. They were reeling at 71 for 5, but Hussey's crucial partnerships with White and Johnson have got them to a challenging total. South Africa will be a little disappointed , especially after the start they got, but they have the wherewithal to scale down this score.
Hashim Amla and Gibbs to open. Mitchell Johnson to start proceedings for Australia. Two slips in place.

Good spot, Vineet. Ananth Narayanan, who regularly blogs for us on It Figures, according to his analysis, feels 165 is a highly competitive first innings score in Twenty20 cricket. Can South Africa surpass it?
Johnson to Amla, no run nipped back in sharply, and some good bounce too, short of a good length outside off, tries to cut but the ball jags back in to hit him on the thighs
Johnson to Amla, 2 runs short of a length on middle and leg, tucked away wide of fine leg off the back foot for a couple
Johnson to Amla, no run short of a good length on middle, defended off the back foot short of square leg
Johnson to Amla, 1 wide wide, bouncer banged in short outside leg, given a wide, South Africa will welcome that
Johnson to Amla, 1 run good length on the off stump, drops it short of point and races for a quick single, easily done
Johnson to Gibbs, 2 runs does well, back of a length on the leg stump, works it away fine, just wide of fine leg, for a couple
Johnson to Gibbs, 1 run almost dragged it on, full outside off, goes for a blazing drive through the covers, gets a thick inside edge towards fine leg
Harwood to Gibbs, FOUR runs bouncer banged in on middle, tries to hook that down behind square, gets the top-edge over the keeper's head for a boundary
Harwood to Gibbs, FOUR runs pulled away, long hop on middle, dismisses it over square leg for a boundary
Harwood to Gibbs, 1 run short of a good length outside off, checks his shot, dabs it uppishly towards mid-off for a single
Harwood to Amla, 1 wide bouncer outside leg stump, erring in line here, given a wide
Harwood to Amla, 1 run good length on middle and leg, pushed wide of midwicket for a single
Harwood to Gibbs, SIX runs Harwood's being punished, bowled on a good length outside off, Gibbs charges down the track and smashes it over the extra-cover boundary
Harwood to Gibbs, no run good comeback, bowled on a good length on middle, Gibbs, rather respectfully, defends it back to the bowler
Johnson to Amla, no run full on middle and off, pushed down the ground to mid-on, came in a touch
Johnson to Amla, 1 run short on middle, tried to pull it away behind square, was hit on the gloves and the ball rolls towards square leg, they take a single
Johnson to Gibbs, no run short of a good length on middle, turned away to square leg off the back foot
Johnson to Gibbs, no run struck that well but straight to cover, low full toss on the off stump, makes room and creams it, but straight to the fielder
Johnson to Gibbs, no run slower ball bowled short outside off, Gibbs plays the right shot, but is into it too early, also, he fails to pick the pace there, misses

Johnson to Gibbs, 1 run almost a run out, dabbed into the off side short of cover, Clarke charges in and rockets in a throw towards the non-striker's end, misses, Gibbs was short had that hit, was struggling to complete the single there
Geeves to de Villiers, (no ball) 1 run oversteps, tucked into the leg side for a single, concedes a freehit
Geeves to Amla, no run slashes and misses, short and wide, should have been dismissed to the point boundary, wasted opportunity
Geeves to Amla, 2 runs just over the short square-leg fielder, short of a good length on middle, turned away uppishly just wide of the catcher on the leg side, gets a couple
Geeves to Amla, 1 run back of a length outside off, pushed wide of mid-of for a quick single
Geeves to de Villiers, 1 run straying on the pads, flicked away fine but some good fielding in the deep by Warner keeps them to a single
Geeves to Amla, FOUR runs full and wide, Amla seizes the chance, creams that through the covers for a pressure-relieving boundary
Harwood to de Villiers, no run short of a good length, bowled at 142.3 kmph outside off, chopped down to cover, mistimed cut there
Harwood to de Villiers, FOUR runs short again and pays the price this time, change of tactic from de Villiers who drags it wide of mid-on this time, works for him, gets a boundary
Harwood to de Villiers, no run beaten this time, well done Harwood, good length outside off, spat off the pitch, moved away just as de Villiers got back to defend, beat the outside edge there
Harwood to de Villiers, 1 run full and wide, mistimes a drive wide of cover where Clarke dives to keep them to a single

Harwood to Amla, 1 wide driving length outside off and Amla goes for it, moves away after pitching, the batsman misses, and the bowler is awarded with a wide called by the umpire, a little too harsh there
Harwood to Amla, FOUR runs that's cost him, short outside off, Amla plays an identical shot attempted by de Villiers earlier in the over, pulls it away wide of mid-on
Harwood to Amla, no run full on middle, driven back firmly to the bowler, a sound start by South Africa here, Amla's looking solid
Geeves to Duminy, no run full on middle and off, pushed to cover off the front foot
Geeves to Duminy, no run short of a good length on the off stump, dabbed to point off the back foot
Geeves to Duminy, no run good length on the off stump, bowled at 121.1 kmph, defended cautiously towards cover
Geeves to Duminy, no run fullish outside off, tries to drive it through the line towards mid-off, hits the inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler
Geeves to Duminy, 2 runs good length on middle and leg, worked away gently between mid-on and midwicket for a single
Hussey to Amla, no run tossed up on middle, pushed back to the bowler
Hussey to Amla, 1 run good length on the off stump, pushed wide of midwicket for a single
Hussey to Duminy, 1 run round the wicket to the left-hander, quicker and full on the off stump, eased wide of cover, 50 up for the hosts
Hussey to Amla, 1 run tossed up on middle and leg, driven down the ground to long-on
Hussey to Duminy, 1 run flighted on middle and off, punched down the ground to long-off
Hussey to Amla, 1 run full on the off stump, bunts it down to long-off for another run
Hopes to Amla, no run beats him rightaway, good length outside off, moves away prodigiously after pitching, Amla, who's moves across to defend it on the off side, misses
Hopes to Amla, no run short and wide, goes for the cut, misses, should have connected there
Hopes to Amla, 2 runs good length on the off stump, driven on the up off the front foot wide of deep cover for a couple
Hopes to Amla, no run short of a length on leg stump, tries to help it on its way to the fine-leg boundary, gets a tickle off the glove on the bounce to the keeper, missed out there
Hopes to Amla, 1 run pushed off the back foot wide of Ponting at cover, he throws at the striker's end but Duminy, thanks to an awkward slide, is in safely
Hopes to Duminy, 1 run fullish on the off stump, driven down the ground to long-on for a single
Hussey to Duminy, no run quick and full on middle and leg, tries to drill it down the ground, gets a thin inside edge onto his pads
Hussey to Duminy, no run shorter on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
Hussey to Duminy, 2 runs long hop, on middle, pulled away wide of deep midwicket for a couple
Hussey to Duminy, 1 run driven off the front foot towards Clarke at cover who fumbles to allow them a single
Hussey to Amla, FOUR runs excellent shot, flighted and full outside off, makes room and drives it through the line wide of extra cover for a boundary, sheer class there, found the gap to perfection
Hopes to Duminy, 1 run short of a good length outside off, runs it down to third man off the back foot
Hopes to Vaughn, 1 run full on the off stump, pushed off the front foot with a straight bat to mid-off
Hopes to Duminy, 1 run back of a length on the off stump, opens the face to guide it to third man
Hopes to Vaughn, no run slower ball bowled on a good length outside off, took van Jaarsveld by surprise there, zipped off the pitch to bat the outside edge
Hopes to Vaughn, 1 run short on leg stump, tucked away behind square for a single
Hopes to Duminy, 1 run goes for it, just a fraction short on middle, comes down the track and pulls it away towards deep square leg, mistimes it but gets a single for his efforts
Hussey to Duminy, no run full on the off stump, defended off the front foot back to the bowler
Hussey to Duminy, 1 run driven down the ground to long-on for a single
Hussey to Vaughn, no run yorker length on middle, dug out back to the bowler

Hussey to Vaughn, no run appeal for un out, full on the off stump, pushed back firmly to the bowler, Duminy has backed up a little too much there, Hussey picks it up and flicks it back onto the stumps at the non-striker's end, the batsman is in a spot of bother thee, replays suggest that the bail was not completely dislodged at the time he
Hussey to Vaughn, 1 run
Hussey to Duminy, 1 run full toss on the off stump, driven to long-on for a single
Hopes to Duminy, FOUR runs timely boundary, short of a length outside off, makes room coming forward and cuts it away over point
Hopes to Duminy, FOUR runs the buzz is back, full outside leg stump, tickles it to the fine-leg boundary, poor ball but he gave it the right treatment
Hopes to Duminy, 1 wide slower ball outside leg stump, cut back in to miss the leg stump but it's still down the leg side, given a wide

Hopes to Duminy, OUT big wicket! Just when it seemed Duminy was helping his team claw back, Hopes has uprooted his off stump. Short of a length and Duminy is tempted to go for a cross-batted pull over midwicket, the ball keeps a little low, he misses and the sticks behind him take a beating.
Hopes to Boucher, no run good length on middle, pushes him back, he defends it to midwicket
Hopes to Boucher, no run in the channel on the off stump, defends with a full face back to the bowler
Hopes to Boucher, 2 runs goes for it, full outside off, tries to loft it over mid-off, just about manages it, hits the toe-end of the bat, lucky escape there, gets a single on top of that
Hussey to Morkel, 1 run flighted on the off stump, driven to long-off, he's a capable hitter Morkel, can he pull off something special here?
Hussey to Boucher, 1 run flighted on middle, comes down the track and pushes that to long-on
Hussey to Morkel, 1 leg bye flat and short on leg stump, turned away wide of midwicket, well it hits his thighs
Hussey to Boucher, no run full on middle, pushed off the front foot to cover
Hussey to Boucher, FOUR runs first bowling lapse for Hussey, full toss on middle, Boucher pulls it away through the square-leg region for a boundary
Johnson to Morkel, 1 wide starts with a wide down the leg side, Australia can afford one every now and then with the position they are in
Johnson to Morkel, 1 run full on the leg side, drives it wristily towards deep midwicket
Johnson to Boucher, 1 run good length on leg stump, shuffles and tickles it to fine leg
Johnson to Morkel, 1 wide wide again, fullish outside off but a little too wide, Morkel withdraws from a drive and wins a wide for his efforts
Johnson to Morkel, no run not this time, much closer to the off stump, makes room to steer it past point, misses
Johnson to Morkel, no run short of a good length outside off, pushed to point off the back foot
Johnson to Morkel, 1 run short and wide, slashed away to third man, the task is getting difficult by the ball for the hosts now
Johnson to Boucher, 1 wide bouncer banged in short on middle, called a wide, rightly so, it's too high
Johnson to Boucher, 1 run short on leg stump, pulled away towards fine leg for a single
Harwood to Boucher, no run starts with a juicy full toss on the off stump, Boucher mistimes it to midwicket, missed out there
Harwood to Boucher, 1 run short of a length on the off stump, goes for the pull again, gets an inside edge onto his pads and they get a single on the off side
Harwood to Morkel, FOUR runs a much-needed boundary, full toss outside off, slices it away over point, brings up the 100 for South Africa
Harwood to Morkel, 1 leg bye full on the leg stump, should have glanced it down fine but misses, is struck on the pads and they get a leg bye
Harwood to Boucher, 1 run full outside off, steered towards Clarke at point who misfields to allow them a single

Harwood to Morkel, 1 run run out chance, full on the off stump, drilled to mid-off where the fielder attempts a direct hit at the non-striker's end and misses by a whisker, Morkel was a dead duck had that hit
Geeves to Morkel, SIX runs full on leg stump and he picks it beautifully, stands his ground and dismisses it over the deep square-leg boundary
Geeves to Morkel, FOUR runs Full on middle and leg, stays his ground and smashes that fiercely back past the bowler for a boundary, could this be the over that changes this game?
Geeves to Morkel, 2 runs good length on the off stump, driven towards deep cover where a fumble allows them enough time to get back for the second
Geeves to Morkel, 1 run low full toss on middle and leg, driven down the ground to long-on
Geeves to Boucher, 1 run sensible batting, fullish on middle and leg, pushed through the line to long-on for a single
Geeves to Morkel, 1 run in the slot but fails to cash in, goes really hard at it, tries to slog it over midwicket but mistimes it to long-on instead
Hopes to Morkel, FOUR runs sweetly struck, low full toss on leg stump, he picks it up superbly, drives it over the bowlers head for a boundary wide of long-on
Hopes to Morkel, SIX runs Morkerl's gone berserk! Meaty length ball on the off stump, he's gets stuck into it, dispatches it miles into the crowd between deep midwicket and long-on, poor Hopes
Hopes to Morkel, FOUR runs he's getting pulverized here, full and wide, Morkel makes room and steers it delightfully past point, third man had given up
Hopes to Morkel, 1 run length ball again but all he can manage this time is a single to long-off, Boucher on strike now, Hopes will be relieved
Hopes to Boucher, FOUR runs horrendous bowling by Hopes here, full toss on the off stump, Boucher has no trouble pulling it away between long-on and deep midwicket, another crucial boundary
Hopes to Boucher, 2 runs low full toss on the off stump, steered behind point for a couple towards a diving third man

Johnson to Morkel, OUT Johnson has delivered the breakthrough! Slower ball bowled full on the off stump, Morkel is tempted to dismiss that into the stands once again, fails to connect well this time, lofts it really high and David Hussey takes a well-judged catch running in from long-off
Johnson to Boucher, no run short of a length outside off, chopped down to point
Johnson to Boucher, 1 run an inswinging yorker, on middle and leg, dug out into the off side for a single
Johnson to Botha, 1 wide wide down the leg side, only just though, short of a length on the leg stump and moved down, Botha let it go
Johnson to Botha, 1 run short of a length outside off, cut away towards deep cover, firmly struck but straight to the fielder
Johnson to Boucher, 1 run good length on leg stump, turned away off the back foot towards fine leg, decide wisely against the second
Johnson to Botha, 1 leg bye full on leg stump, swung in to strike him on the pads, they get a leg bye towards third man, would have gone down
Harwood to Botha, FOUR runs shot! Full outside off, Botha gets forward and drives that crisply through the narrow gap between extra cover and mid-off, beautifully timed
Harwood to Botha, 1 run goodish length on middle and leg, driven through the line to long-on
Harwood to Boucher, 3 runs dropped, on middle and leg, goes for a mighty heave over square leg, gets the top edge and takes ages to come down, Geeves going back from short fine drops it but it
Harwood to Botha, 1 run full outside off, gets outside the line to paddle it fine, misses, is struck on the pads and they get a run
Harwood to Boucher, FOUR runs Harwood's had a torrid time, short on the off stump, there to hit, Boucher pulls it away between long-on and deep midwicket, smashed to the boundary
Harwood to Boucher, 1 run manages to finish a disappointing spell with a yorker on leg stump, dug out wide of midwicket for a single
Geeves to Boucher, FOUR runs starts with a horrific full toss on the off stump, it's bread and butter for Boucher who smacks it between deep square leg and deep midwicket for a decisive four

Geeves to Boucher, FOUR runs and it's all over! Australia have thrown it away towards the end, full on the off stump and Boucher slogs it over midwicket for a boundary, the crowd goes wild, and the South Africans - on the field and in the dug out - are ecstatic.

Thanks for tuning in, folks, and sending us all your feedback. Do join us again on the 29th for the second Twenty20 international between these two teams at Centurion. Until then, it's goodbye from all of us here at Cricinfo.

South Africa were in deep trouble at one stage - they were 83 for 5 - but Boucher and Morkel sparked a revival with a stand of 58 for the sixth wicket. Morkel fell for a superb 19-ball 37 but Boucher stayed till the end, repeating his feat in that famous chase of 434, to guide his team to a thrilling four-wicket win.
South Africa won by 4 wickets (with 4 balls remaining)
Player of the match is David Hussey, AUS
